metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5785 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In OpenJPEG 2.3.0, there is an integer overflow caused by an out-of-bounds left shift in the opj_j2k_setup_encoder function (openjp2/j2k.c). Remote attackers could leverage this vulnerability to cause a denial of service via a crafted bmp file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5785` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.3.0-2build0.18.04.1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.3.0-2build0.18.04.1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.3.0-2build0.18.04.1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.3.0-2build0.18.04.1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.3.0-2build0.18.04.1
libopenjpip-server - 2.3.0-2build0.18.04.1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.3.0-2build0.18.04.1
libopenjpip7 - 2.3.0-2build0.18.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: ccdm94> this vulnerability was introduced by the changes of commit 33a0e66eb12.

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.3.0-2build0.18.04.1').
